01582126c860397e8ce635d5d29f4a7e (02:13): SO....anyone else want to take a gander at it and give me a hint as to why the background bottom right image is floating above the bottom of the page?
01582126c860397e8ce635d5d29f4a7e (02:13): It's not a background image issue AFAIK, but that the inner divs have some padding
01582126c860397e8ce635d5d29f4a7e (02:13): but I don't see any padding or margin statements, so no idea why it's like that in IE6 but works everywhere else
01582126c860397e8ce635d5d29f4a7e (02:15): sorry, that's a Joomla!ism, not much control over that
01582126c860397e8ce635d5d29f4a7e (02:15): and, well, Strict stresses me out =)
01582126c860397e8ce635d5d29f4a7e (02:15): cmopared to every other one out there, it's the least evil
01582126c860397e8ce635d5d29f4a7e (02:16): It has issues, and I had to go through and hand edit it to spit out mostly divs instead of tables for formatting, which was a special form of hell for me.
01582126c860397e8ce635d5d29f4a7e (02:18): so now that it's mostly CSS for presentation, I have this one remaining issue with the interior divs padding on IE6 for no apparent reason
01582126c860397e8ce635d5d29f4a7e (02:18): might be the borders and IE6 box model weirdness

46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (03:22): hey folks, why would you use a div "id" attribute over a div "class" attribute?
5a9f5c48597ea33efa706f9d2df628d8 (03:23): a class can to be used by multiple elements at once
46067681ac9be7dadb8303bec3fd93ce (03:23): is there one that is standard?
5a9f5c48597ea33efa706f9d2df628d8 (03:24): ids are necessary when there is more to include than a class can supply alone as that class is limited because its being used by several objects at once
5a9f5c48597ea33efa706f9d2df628d8 (03:25): in other words <img src="" class="used on a bunch of buttons" id="does this uniquely">
